item.title: Sorry, but don't expect to see Wolverine at tomorrow's PlayStation State of Play
item.content:encoded:
Sorry Marvel fans, you may need to retract those claws, as it seems that Insomniac's Wolverine won't be appearing during this week's PlayStation State of Play.

When Sony first announced a State of Play for tomorrow, 12th February, it said the show would last for over 60 minutes, and include "news, gameplay updates, and announcements". Many soon assumed (and hoped) this lengthy broadcast would include a look at Insomniac's Wolverine, which was first teased back in 2021 during a PlayStation Showcase.

To see this content please enable targeting cookies.

However, it now appears that this won't be the case after all. Replying to one fan on social media, who asked when we would all hear and see more from Logan and co, Insomniac replied with a very to the point:

"Spring 2026."

Now, alas, February doesn't exactly fall under the 'spring' window (she writes while looking out at the sunless, grey sky, wondering when the ground will ever be dry again). Spring starts towards the end of March, so unless Insomniac is pulling the wool over our eyes it seems doubtful Wolverine will show up tomorrow night.

Something that may (may) show up though could be the next game from Sony Santa Monica. When asked about a possible appearance from the team during tomorrow's State of Play, industry insider Shinobi602 responded: “Wouldn’t be super surprising given the target release window." They did stress, though, "this isn’t a confirmation it'll be there lol".

Thankfully, we don't have too much longer to find out what Sony has up its sleeve, with tomorrow's State of Play kicking off at 10pm UK time. What do you hope to see there?

In the meantime, while we may not be getting Wolverine news this month, we do have another Marvel-flavoured leak for February. Recent rumours suggest that Marvel's Spider-Man 2 will be headlining PlayStation's PS Plus Extra games for February.

item.title: PlayStation Plus Extra February games leak ahead of tomorrow's State of Play
item.content:encoded:
Marvel's Spider-Man 2! Neva! More!

It seems that PlayStation's upcoming PS Plus Extra games for February have leaked.

According to the ever reliable dealabs, PS Plus members can expect to get their hands on the following three titles:

  • Marvel's Spider-Man 2 (PS5)
  • Test Drive Unlimited Solar Crown (PS5)
  • Neva (PS5/PS4)

To see this content please enable targeting cookies.

The big headliner here is Marvel's Spider-Man 2, which reunites players with Spider-Man (of course) as well as Miles Morales and MJ. "At once a little simple and a little over-stuffed, Marvel's Spider-Man 2 is still above all a game of immense charm and fluid, free-form style," reads our four star review from 2023.

I would also fully recommend Neva, which is the most recent game from Gris developer Nomada Studio. It follows the story of a young woman named Alba and a magnificent wolf, with whom she forms a lifelong bond.

We also awarded Neva four stars on its release. "Nomada Studio follows up on the striking Gris with an effort that's poignant and precise, if maybe just a tad melodramatic," reads Eurogamer's Neva review from 2024.

It is expected that Sony will officially announce February's PS Plus Extra games in the very near future, perhaps during this week's State of Play, so stay tuned for more.

For more on the service, be sure to check out our guide to PS Plus and all the available games.
